item.description:
Alexis (the NHC's resident professional classical pianist) will be playing a fund-raising concert to benefit the Hamden Rotary Club. The pieces for the concert will include classical and popular music. She will be playing solo, as well as an accompanist, including with high-school-aged winners & other runner-ups of the Hamden Symphony's Youth Concerto Competition. 7-9pm, but I'm guessing it wouldn't be a problem if you had to come late or leave early (though that might mean you miss Alexis' solo). In the Buckman Center at Quinnipiac Univ. in Hamden.

POST-PARTY: There's a pretty high likelihood that we'll be up for hanging-out in some fashion afterwards if anyone's interested...food, drink?

The Rotary Club is devoted to fans of highway rotaries in all their gloriousness. Either that or they're a community service organization, I keep getting that mixed-up.

You can hear Alexis playing some Mozart at her site:
www.myspace.com/alexiszingalepianist

COST: Donation (to benefit Rotary Club)

HOST: Alexis 203-747-9203 (however due to teaching + warm-up, she may be pretty un-reachable all day until the concert is done; texting may be your best shot at reaching her)
Jason 203-901-4957 (calling or texting is fine)

DIRECTIONS: It'll be in the Buckman Center at Quinnipiac Univ. in Hamden. For general directions to Quinnipiac click here. When you enter Q.U., ask the guard for directions.

If you want, you can see a campus map here. Assuming you're entering from the front main entrance (Mt. Carmel Ave)...not the Harwood entrance (also on Mt. Carmel Ave)...Buckman Center is a circular building set fairly far back on campus towards the right. You could enter through the New Road entrance (on the right side), which will put you much closer, but I don't know how much parking is available there.

Parking is free.

If you want to arrange car-pools, chat about the event, etc, click here to visit the thread on the message board
item.name: Thu 10/9 - Alexis benefit concert for Rotary Club
